com.intel.realsense.tracking

Interface ControllerEvent


  • public interface ControllerEvent
    ControllerEvent represents generalized controller event (vendor specific).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getControllerIndex()
      getControllerIndex returns the index of the controller bounded to this event.
      byte[] getData()
      getData returns a pass-through data from the controller FW.
      int getEventId()
      getEventId returns the ID of the sensor that triggered the event (vendor specific).
      int getInstanceId()
      getInstanceId returns the instance of the sensor in case of multiple sensors.
      long getSystemTimestamp()
      Gets a correlated timestamp to the host OS system clock.
      long getTimestamp()
      Gets the Banner Ridge module internal hardware clock, this clock is reset to zero when the module is power up.

    • Method Detail

      • getControllerIndex

        int getControllerIndex()
        getControllerIndex returns the index of the controller bounded to this event.
        Returns:
        the controller index.

      • getEventId

        int getEventId()
        getEventId returns the ID of the sensor that triggered the event (vendor specific). Supporting 0-63 values.
        Returns:
        the event ID : 0 - button state, 1 - trackpad, 2 - battery.

      • getInstanceId

        int getInstanceId()
        getInstanceId returns the instance of the sensor in case of multiple sensors.
        Returns:
        the instance ID.

      • getData

        byte[] getData()
        getData returns a pass-through data from the controller FW. For button state, 1 byte of data, the rest is reserved : 0 - Invalid 1 - Pressed 2 - Released For battery level. 2 bytes of data, the rest is reserved.
        Returns:
        byte[] array of vendor specific data, size of 6 bytes.

      • getTimestamp

        long getTimestamp()
        Gets the Banner Ridge module internal hardware clock, this clock is reset to zero when the module is power up.
        Returns:
        Device timestamp.

      • getSystemTimestamp

        long getSystemTimestamp()
        Gets a correlated timestamp to the host OS system clock.
        Returns:
        Device timestamp.
